Package core.modAPI

Interface Brain

  • public interface Brain
    This interface allows you to write your own code to model a brain for the creatures. Only one implementation of this interface can be loaded at once.
    Author:
    clay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canMate​(java.util.List<Brain> parents)
      This function will essentially be called statically.
      void draw​(processing.core.PFont font, float scaleUp, int mX, int mY)
      Draw the brain! Please use Processing's built-in tools for this.

      This method is used to revive brains essentially from cryosleep

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init​(Creature c,
          Board b,
          java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputsRequired,
          java.util.List<java.lang.String> outputsRequired)
        Initialization. Note: if you do not set up this brain object to provide all outputs specified by outputsRequired, bad things will probably happen.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature that this brain object will belong to
        b - the board that the Creature c lives on
        inputsRequired - a list of all the inputs this brain object will have to take into account
        outputsRequired - a list of all the outputs this brain must provide

      • think

        void think​(Creature c,
           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> peripheralInputs,
           Board b,
           double timeStep)
        This is the "update" method. It is called once per tic, before outputs are retrieved from this brain object.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature this brain belongs to
        peripheralInputs - the current values of the inputs specified in the init() method
        b - the board that creature c lives on
        timeStep - I'm going to be totally honest, I have no idea what timeStep is for. It propogates down the method calls from EvolvioMod.TIME_STEP. Check EvolvioBrain in the "Evolvio Original" mod for an example on what to do with it

      • getOutput

        double getOutput​(java.lang.String name)
        Called after think(), once per output specified in init(). Please return a value for each of these, getOutput() will never be called with an invalid value of name
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the output whose value was requested
        Returns:
        the value of the requested output

      • getOffspring

        Brain getOffspring​(java.util.List<Creature> parents,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> inputsRequired,
                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> outputsRequired)
        Called when one or more creatures reproduce. This is your chance to have the creatures' brains evolve!
        Parameters:
        parents - a list of all the parents involved in the creation of this new life. You can assume that all elements of this List are instances of your Brain implementation
        inputsRequired - all the inputs that this new brain will be required to consider (same as init)
        outputsRequired - a list of all the outputs this brain must provide (same as init)
        Returns:
        an entirely new brain object (with no references shared with its parents) that is the result of the parents mating

      • draw

        void draw​(processing.core.PFont font,
          float scaleUp,
          int mX,
          int mY)
        Draw the brain! Please use Processing's built-in tools for this. Don't worry about where to draw it, the drawspace has already been translated to the right spot for you.
        Parameters:
        font - the font used for drawing text
        scaleUp - what scale to draw the brain at
        mX - the relative x coordinate of the mouse (if this seems wrong, that's on me)
        mY - the relative y coordinate of the mouse (if this seems wrong, that's on me)

      • makeString

        java.lang.String makeString()
        This function is used to write this brain to file to save it from permanent deletion.
        Returns:
        A string containing all of the information needed to reconstruct this brain.

      • fromString

        Brain fromString​(java.lang.String s)
        This method is used to revive brains essentially from cryosleep
        Parameters:
        s - a string previously returned from toString()
        Returns:
        the brain revived from the string representation s

      • canMate

        boolean canMate​(java.util.List<Brain> parents)
        This function will essentially be called statically. I would declare this as a staic method, but interfaces can't have static abstract methods.
        This method is called just before getOffspring(), which is only called if this function returns true
        Parameters:
        parents - A list of prospective parents' brains. You can assume that all elements of this List are instances of your Brain implementation
        Returns:
        whether or not the parents in the list can all mate with each other
